hero.title: Hello, I'm Maksim
hero.description: Frontend / Fullstack developer focused on React, Next.js, Tailwind, WebSocket, and Node.js

description.title: About Me
description.paragraf1: I am a web developer with experience in building applications using React and Next.js. I work on API development, database integration, and project architecture optimization. I also have experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD setup, and infrastructure management.
description.paragraf2: I am interested in frontend development, interactive graphics (WebGL/shaders), and building complex UI components with animations. In my projects, I focus on code quality, user experience, and maintainable architecture.
description.paragraf3: My goal is to grow into a Senior Developer, dive deeper into application architecture, experiment with graphics, and create products with strong technical and visual foundations.

items.title: Interactive Markdown Editor
items.description: A full-featured markdown editor with support for emojis, GIFs, live preview, and custom infographics. Built with React, Zustand, and the Giphy API.

items.title: Visual DSL Editor
items.description: A block-based editor for building object behavior, featuring drag-and-drop, JSON export, and a built-in interpreter.

about.title: About Me
about.content:
Frontend developer (React + TypeScript) with commercial development experience. During my year at a web studio, I optimized client websites using modern technology stack. Independently built several large applications, including an interactive platform with online code editor and automated testing.

I confidently master the React ecosystem: RTK Query, TanStack Query, Zustand, Next.js 14 App Router, application architecture and performance optimization. I quickly learn new technologies, focus on clean code and quality results.

Ready to take on junior+ level challenges from day one and continuously develop towards a senior developer position.

position1.description: Development and optimization of client websites
responsibilities: Developed and modernized client websites on 1C-Bitrix24
Completed tasks according to specifications: new pages, forms, integrations, bug fixes
Optimized loading speed and mobile responsiveness (PageSpeed 90+ scores)
Worked on accessibility (WCAG) and basic SEO: meta tags, friendly URLs, schema.org markup
Wrote custom scripts and widgets in JavaScript, sometimes React/Vue for individual blocks
Worked with constructors (Bitrix, wordpress, sometimes Tilda), made changes to PHP templates
Received feedback from managers and clients, completed tasks on time
achievements: Reduced application response time by 30% through database query optimization and caching implementation
Increased application scalability by developing a new API architecture, allowing processing of 50% more requests during peak hours

education1.institution: Nizhny Tagil Trade and Economics College

project1.title: Website Catalog Structure Changes
project1.description: Worked on restructuring the main website catalog to improve conversion and fix friendly URL issues. Added more logical navigation and optimized category distribution. As a result, user behavior improved and page visibility in search increased.

honor1.title: Winner of 'Future Technologies' Hackathon
honor1.description: As part of a team, developed an application for automating processes in education. The application received high marks from the jury for innovation and practical value.

cookie.message: We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience, serve personalized content, and analyze our traffic. By clicking Accept All, you consent to our

cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how Maksim Ivanov uses cookies and similar technologies on this website.

whatAreCookies.title: What are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They allow the website to remember your actions and preferences over a period of time, so you don't have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site.

howWeUse.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUse.content: We use cookies for the following purposes:
howWeUse.essential: Essential Cookies: These are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be switched off in our systems.
howWeUse.preferences: Preference Cookies: These allow the website to remember choices you make and provide enhanced, more personal features.
howWeUse.analytics: Analytics Cookies: These help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.
howWeUse.language: Language Selection: To remember your language preference

thirdParty.title: Third-party Cookies
thirdParty.content: We may also use third-party services that place cookies on your device. For example:
thirdParty.analytics: Analytics services for website traffic analysis
thirdParty.social: Social media plugins or integration (if applicable)

yourRights.title: Your Rights and Choices
yourRights.content: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie rights by setting your preferences in the cookie consent banner or by managing your browser settings. Please note that essential cookies cannot be rejected as they are necessary for the website to function.

manageCookies.title: How to Manage Cookies
manageCookies.content: Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can usually find these settings in the 'Options' or 'Preferences' menu of your browser. However, please note that disabling cookies may affect the functionality of this website.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about our use of cookies or this Cookie Policy, please contact us.

footer.text: Maksim | Site made with Next.js, Tailwind, and framer-motion
